page.title: 09Horsted Place Little Horsted
page.content: The house,built in{1850,}has had two owners and was used as a family home until 1984 when it was bought by a Canadian Company concerned with{'Time {Share'}accommodation. The 98 acre Estate was then split up and sold at auction. Twenty acres were retained for a hotel development. The new owners hope to attract rich {executives}from N.America with busi- ness interests in London and 'leisure' {travellers.}The Gothic mansion will be restored and 18 suites designed each of their own style and character. As well as the attraction of an historic house with{Royal}connections, set in attractive surroundings, the Company hopes to provide leisure activities: fishing,tennis,sauna,heated swimming pool & formal gardens. There will be board rooms and conference facilities with provision for dining/banqueting.
